author: DadOrDieTrying
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2016
review_content: We absolutely love this game! The sad part is that the world has become accustomed to cheaply made products. Unfortunately, this is just a price we have to pay if we want affordable products. Hasbro has done a wonderful job ensuring that Connect 4 continues to be a part of our lives, but if you're looking for the sturdy game you had when you were a kid, this one falls a little short. The rack is flimsy and made of thin plastic, and the discs lack that heavy checker weight, BUT they totally work. Just mentioning it for the people who are nostalgic, this game just feels a little different. Our kids don't know the difference and it certainly doesn't matter when you measure the memories that were making with them, but it is nice to remember some of the differences from when we were kids.
title: Still the Same Awesome Game!

author: Small~Town~Girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2017
review_content: Hasbro Connect 4 Game was one of our daughter's absolute favorite games to play, growing up. In fact, she and her dad played a game of it almost every night as part of her bedtime routine. Our daughter now has kids of her own and it is time to continue the tradition of playing this game. We ordered it at Christmastime and have been looking forward to playing it with the grandchildren. It got set aside, but has now been noticed again by our grandson and he is very excited to play it. Got it out and put it together, ready for his next visit. Looks about the same as it did back then. There is some fun to be had here. Looking forward to many years of making new and fabulous memories of Connect 4 with the grandchildren.
title: ~ Continuing the Connect 4 Tradition with the Grandchildren ~

author: Pop Bop
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019
review_content: Anyone can play it. It's ready to go out of the box. You can play for minutes or an hour. Losing a disc somewhere under the couch isn't the end of the world. Kids different ages can still play with each other. This is an essential go to the toy closet sort  of item. I was afraid a new one like this might be cheaper feeling or flimsier than the older ones, but was pleased to see that while it won't survive really rough handling the toy is durable enough for normal little kid play.
title: There's A Good Reason It's A Classic

author: DobieOne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2017
review_content: OK, This one was the biggest hit of all. Of course, she beat the pants off of me but had a great time doing it. Grandparents beware - your little grandchildren love playing games and they are good at it. My 7-yr-old granddaughter can play me like a fiddle and beat my butt on Connect 4. Finally after beating me time after time, she admitted that one of her pre-school teachers had taught her game strategy on winning in this game and she took pity and tried to teach me some of her tricks. :) Gotta love the little children.
title: CONNECT 4 WAS A HUGE HIT WITH MY 7-YR-OLD GRANDDAUGHTER :) She beat my pants off

author: shopgirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2016
review_content: I really loved Connect 4 when I was a kid. Then I bought this for my 3 year old and 1 year old. Although they are not playing by the rules, putting the discs into the slot keeps them busy. It's also a good tool to teach colors and counting as well as learn about taking turns. A+ plus in my book.
title: Great learning tool for toddlers.

author: RedPanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
review_content: I bought this to relive my childhood memories back in elementary school, but also to teach my nephews how to play Connect 4. It's so fun and easy to learn. I am a cynical uncle by making my nephews eat the Beanboozle Jellybeans if they lose (which is 98% of the time). Other than that, very quick, easy, entertaining, and builds strategies for young children where their brains are still developing via the Connect 4 game (probably not the jellybeans part).
title: A Fun Classic Game

author: Teacher, Mom, 40-Something
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2016
review_content: This is the same classic game that I played when I was a kid, and now I can play it with my children! The goal is the same--to get four colors in a row. At first my children struggles with predicting where a player might go next, but after playing with it for a while, they've really started to get the knack for it. It has helped them to develop critical thinking skills. We got the game at Christmas, and it's now eight months later and they still pull it out to play all the time. I think this one will be a keeper.
title: What's Not to Love with this Classic?

author: K. Polizzi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: I bought this game for my two boys (9 and 6) to play together because i remembered having it and loving it as a child and knew that they would enjoy it also. I was right. They played non stop, switching sides constantly hah. Game is sturdy enough to withstand my boys and thats saying something. I wouldn't travel with the one of the original size because it would be tricky, with all the counters etc but you could make it work using the box as a level ground to play on. I would go ahead and just purchase the miniature version though if needed for the car. There are so many wonderful ways to use Connect Four as a game, especially if homeschooling. For instance, I used little round price stickers and wrote letters on them to teach my youngest his letters. The players would then say the letter names and sounds as they put them in the slot. Then, with my oldest, I wrote sight words. You could do numbers, suffixes, nouns etc. Love that this game is also one I actually want to play. I dont run and hide when my kids suggest playing a board game anymore. It's quick, fun and easy to put away when done. Gets them thinking of strategy and, as stated above, many other things depending on how you use it. All round great game.
title: My fave childhood game!

author: ChiGirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: This is a review of Amazon warehouse product and not the game itself.  I bought from Amazon warehouse because I thought the pieces might get lost before my child is old enough to understand strategy.  The description said box was damaged but product was new.  This is clearly not true.  Additionally I normally just drop return off at whole foods which is really easy for me, but that is not an option for this product so it's going to be a pain to return.  They should let me throw the item away and refund my money
title: Badly damaged game

author: Kronin323
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2017
review_content: The classic game, just like I remember from my childhood. (Or is it? I remember the pieces being red and black, not red and yellow, but maybe I'm confused...)Introducing it to my daughter, she's loving it.For classic gameplay, this does the trick.  However, this original design only allows classic gameplay, due to an all-or-nothing mechanism to remove pieces from the bottom.  Apparently other versions of this game exist that allow you to remove pieces one at a time, which allows additional variations of gameplay.  Check out the Wikipedia article on this game for descriptions of those variations, if interested.So, 5 stars for the classic game, minus one star for the lack of the more advanced one-at-a-time removal mechanism.
title: Classic

author: Taco
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: Given the virus and need to social distance, I bought a bunch of board games to play with the family at home.I remembered this game from my youth.  I remember being super competitive and playing this with my brother and friends for hours. For some reason I remember being really good.I remembered wrong.First my 14 year old son proceeded to spank me 5 times in a row before declaring playing with me was too easy and that I should try playing with my 6 year old nephew first for practice.  I hit my tongue while chewing on some humble lie and pretended to laugh as my little nephew climbed into my son's lap across from me and then proceeded to win 4 out of 5 games with no coaching from my son.Since I managed to win the last game, I decided to retire on a winning note.I have now hidden the game and am now secretly playing online until I can play well enough to kick both their butts.II'll let you know how that goes.
title: Everyone thinks they're good at this game until they lose to a 6 year-old

author: Kat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_content: I had taught my son when he was 5 how to play Connect 4, only it was on an old school version. The legs slid off and snapped together to create a holder that would balance (if you were lucky). We decided to take that one to grandma's house and get a newer one. He likes the red and the yellow chips and I love the foldability of it. When I was a kid (too long ago), my brother and I had a travel Connect 4 that had this sliding tray capability and we loved it. I was excited to see this on a larger scale AND knowing that the box lid will actually sit flat (the other one never did). Plus, you can't beat this price to encourage critical thinking skills and hours of endless fun!
title: New update to an old school game.

author: ilearner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
review_content: Purchased for an 'afterschool' program this arrived in summer and was not opened until now, September 3.  Disappointing in that one of the pieces of the frame is missing and the chips that make the game fall right on through the spaces to the table that supports it.  I have attempted to ask for a replacement, but evidently it's been too long.  All of my other purchases were terrific!  Just this one was a bust.
title: Missing piece makes it UNUSABLE/impossible to play

author: JadeVictoria
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019
review_content: This game came with legs and a bottom slider that need to be twisted out of a plastic frame.  The pieces didn't fit together well, and the bottom piece fell off immediately when my kids tried to use it.  When they tried to snap it back on, the pieces broke off.  Really, really junkie.  I do not recommend which is too bad, because the game concept is nice.
title: Incredibly poorly made

author: remote camper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
review_content: It is stated that Capt'n Cook was so obsessed with this game that it became known as the Captain's Mistress.  No real evidence to support that but nevertheless a blast to play.There are strategies that can be applied for the player starting the game as well as the one playing second.  There is a mathematical solution to the game but what fun is that?  Kids will probably love it, too because even if their skill level needs some catching up, you can still fill the slots with them and let them push the lever at the bottom to let all the discs fall in a clatter onto the table when the game is over.  Hours of fun!There are multi skill level free online versions that can get you ready for the real thing.  If you find yourself always in a pickle, they can help you become a better player.  What I like about the game overall is that it is likely better for your brain than simply sitting in front of a screen with a controller---and more interactive and fun than Sudoko!
title: Was Capt'n Cook obsessed with this game?

author: Hope❤️
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: Connect four!  I played this game as a child.  I played this game with my children.  Now I play this Game with my grandchildren!  It is such fun.  Easy, not a lot of cards, a playing board you have to hold still, and a simplicity that even a three or four year old can understand.The price on this game was a bargain.  It seems as though Grampa has been playing it non stop since it got here.The con is traveling!  This is too big of a game, unless it is like for a camper to use in a car.  Other than that, the Game is perfect for our family and passed down through the generations!
title: A great fun game for all ages.  Passed from one generation to another, the fun never leaves!

author: Kryzzle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: This game is very cheaply made. I played it with my 6 year old and twice we had to restart the game bc all the pieces fell out. The piece at the bottom that you slide sideways to release the pieces is loose and slides randomly during the play. Very disappointed
title: Crappy craftsmanship

author: guitarchick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
review_content: The bottom bar broke within a month of getting this for my son. I was really disappointed. I've tried to glue it back together, but surprise, surprise, that doesn't work. I wish that sliding bar was made better and not so easy to break.
title: Sliding bar breaks easily.

author: BeautifullyMeInside&Out
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2015
review_content: This is the same game I grew up playing years ago and no matter how simple the idea...it's always fun and so addicting.As a busy mom to three kids, it's hard to juggle all I have to get done and still get in quality time with my children.  Some games can take hours to play from start to finish but this one is  easy to set up and play and can be really quick.The idea is to connect 4 of your color pieces in a row (straight or diagnal) while strategically also blocking your partner from doing the same first.  First to successfully connect 4 of their game pieces wins.  It's a bit like tic-tac-toe.The entire game can be as short as 1 minute to maxing out around 5-10 minutes (unless your child takes really long turns...like sings eeny-meeny-miny-mo followed by the "bubble gum, bubble gum in a dish" chant every turn)It's short enough that I can play a few rounds and then let the kids verse each other while I finish up cleaning or whatever.We have now owned this game for one whole year and it's not broken, the pieces are not lost and we still play it which is FAR more than I can say for Monopoly <---That game never ends!!! Am I right mama's??
title: Probably the only thing I bought last Christmas that we still play it, didn't break and have all the pieces to!

author: Minh N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
review_content: I purchased several "classic" board games to introduce to my 5 yr old. She really enjoys tic-tac-toe so I knew she would like Connect Four. The game pieces and frame are plastic, the legs are detachable for storage back in the box, hopefully they are sturdy enough to withstand play from both the 5 yr old and 2 yr old. Their favorite part of the game is at the end when you release all the stacked pieces from the slide in the bottom.
title: Just as I remember

author: Steppytoe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: We play it a bit unconventionally....instead of a head to head match, We set it up in the dining room; as we pass by randomly during the day we make a move; leaving a quarter next to the other persons pieces to alert them its their turn...sometimes we only get in about 2 moves a day if we have to work.  It ends up taking about a week to complete the game, but its loads of fun as we talk crap about who gonna win  all week via text messages, etc.  I might make a move before I go to bed; he works a different shift....then when I get up in the morning he's made a move and left a note with some smart quip or wise crack.  A great distraction during COVID-19 Lock-down.
title: Still a Fun Game!

author: Yakov G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
review_content: I wanted to get this for my kids as it is a classic game from my youth. The original one I had in the 80s, I must have played with 500x, no problems. I'm sure if I could find it at my dad's house, it would still be fine. This piece of crap broke in 1 day! 1 day! It felt flimsy from the beginning and the slider broke and cracked just from a few plays. Are people actually reviewing the quality of this game or the game itself? It may be a great classic game but this actual version of it can't possibly be getting legit 5 star reviews.
title: Cheap garbage

author: Quipper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
review_content: When assembled, the game won't fit in its box. This makes no sense, since it's clearly a game primarily aimed at young children--if both players play perfectly, as in Tick-Tac-Toe, it's always a draw. My 8 year-old never loses! Game also says adult assembly required. So the game maker expects a parent to put it together and take it apart every time, which is ridiculous since if they'd spent a few extra cents on a larger box, the problem would not exist. Called their customer service number and asked for a suitable box, but not only was turned down but the lady acted as though expecting the game to fit in its storage box was silly!
title: Buy a different set if possible!

author: Aardvark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: Connect 4 is a longstanding family favorite. I’ve picked up where my mom left off with our own grandkids. She used to bring her set every single time she visited us. So easy to pack it in her suitcase (the maker should consider selling a deluxe version in its own carrying case). It’s one of our kids’ best memory of Grandma.It’s inexpensive, especially when you consider the educational benefits from a game that’s not only engaging and usable by a wide range of ages, but will teach logic and thinking skills. Add this to your family game cupboard and you’ll soon see it’s value.
title: Family Favorite—Fun & Educational

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2017
review_content: Always loved the Connect 4 game since I was a kid myself! However, the quality of the game was a little cheap and not what I recall having as a child as it kept falling apart often after dropping a token in or at the end of the game when you let the tokens out. Somewhat of a nuisance therefore not interested in playing too often with my grandchildren. Otherwise, it arrived in a timely fashion and was well packaged.
title: Always loved the Connect 4 game since I was a kid ...

author: The Consumer's Voice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2019
review_content: It's a fun game, you can really go a marathon with it, but the vertical game housing doesn't allow all the pieces to fall when trying to clear the board and you have to wiggle it around and shake them out.  Only happens in one channel of the game board, I've looked closely at it, doesn't seem to have any burrs on the plastic, perhaps it was just molded bad.I remember playing this game decades ago, but I don't recall the game board being this flimsy.  It just feels cheap and feels like it could break easily.All in all a fun game, but it's becoming clear that "they just don't make them like they used to."
title: Just like I remembered it, but flimsier.

author: LuckyLiz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: It seems there aren't a lot of games I like that can be played with only 2 players, but Connect 4 is one that can!  I played this with my family and friends when I was a kid and wanted to get this again to keep at my mom's house because it is a simple to play, yet fun game that my mom wouldn't have to learn how to play again.  It is nice to do something other than watch tv all the time, so I have been looking for more games.  This was a great start and under $8.00 was a great price!  So nice to see that some of the old classics are still popular today!
title: A fun classic game

author: Mikee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: I got this game for my kids as they showed interest and connect 4 is such a classic game that we all played growing up.To be honest i expected a solid, robust game but seems things are different now. The platic is super cheap unfortunately even the cardboard is super weak and it broke on the first day. Also there is no way to pack it without disconnecting the sides.Overall it works and kids enjoyed it but i am disappointed how the quality went down dramatically.
title: Very cheap material sadly

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_content: Although, we have not been able to play the game as intended, it has been fun. My grand children 5yrs, 3yrs and 10 months are fascinated by the game. It is usually the first game they choose. Eddy, 3year old, plays to win by getting his color to the last place at the top. I have been able to teach him the concept of "taking turns" and "no cheating". It is fun and I am glad that I bought this game.
title: My turn!

author: Ahmed Shaffie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: the material quality is not that good but the game it self is really interesting I like it so much but they need to work alot on the material of the game it broke very easy but it still work
title: just for a game

author: Sriley28
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: This is a great classic game, but gave it a one star because I gifted it to my nephew for his 6th birthday at the end of September and they just opened it to play and there was a piece missing at the bottom, so it wouldn’t hold the pieces in. I would exchange, but the return window is closed. Very disappointed.
title: Missing piece to the bottom of the game.

author: kimberley  Frank
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_content: Cheaply made of plastic. Falls over and I am sorry I gave this as a present!!
title: Not sturdy

author: JennyJen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: What makes this game fun?  Let me hit some highlights for you.....It's been the same for 40+ years... that's right it doesn't induce rage like monopoly.You can teach your preschooler how to play.You can play on game night with your friends after drinking.You don't have to remember to yell "UNO" although if you wanted you could make it interesting by yelling "cuatro"I'm still working on the win to loss ratio for beating my preschooler.  He needs to learn he doesn't get to win all the time.Overall, it's what I expected and arrived in good condition.
title: If you played it as a child, you shouldn't be surprised when you open this box.

author: Erich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2018
review_content: This game is a classic. I played it when I was a kid, and got this to play with my 4.5 year old daughter. She regularly kicks my ass. Seriously, I don't let her win in any way, but she takes about 70% of the games from me. From a product point of view, it's an inexpensive plastic frame with some plastic chips. There's not much to it. If you treat it badly, it could break... so be careful with it. In the event it does break, there's a neat invention called "superglue" that could likely put it back together again. Anyhow... this is a fun game and a good value for what it is. Enjoy!
title: this is a fun game and a good value for what it is

author: Brains Report
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2018
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           There are 3 PROS to the Hasbro Connect 4 Game:1. Though it’s made of plastic, it is hard plastic and seems quite durable.2. You can modify the rules to even the playing field between parents and kids.3. The pieces are bright and easy to find (we don’t believe in storing things in boxes.)The 3 CONS are:1. My preschooler is terrible at playing the standard game.2. It’s too easy for him to just “flip the board” so to speak (by shifting the bottom lever and causing the pieces to fall.)3. I have to stay on top of my Connect 4 skills so he will never be able to beat me.My four-year-old son got a $25 Amazon gift card from one of his many grandmas so we took him on a cyber shopping spree. Connect 4 was one of his picks. I had to do a little assembly once it arrived, but it only took a couple minutes. I then tried to explain to him how to play, but he didn’t really care for the rules, especially since I always go hard in the paint (and I expect him to do the same if he wants to get ahead in Trump’s America.)Well, his constantly losing and acting out took its toll. I assure you I offered him encouraging words along the way and pointed out where he should stop me. But alas, the fun just wasn’t there. So, like the government handing out our hard-earned dollars to multinational corporations, I modified the game so he would get to play twice for every single turn I took. This evened the playing field a bit.When my fingers are sore from hours of connecting, I tap out and Bucky has fun just making patterns with the pieces and board.Overall, I’d say he’s gotten his $8 of entertainment out of it in the last couple months. I give it five stars.If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. I’m here to help!
title: I've Modified the Game for My Four-Year-Old

author: Mama V
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
review_content: Great game.  Easy game to learn for my 5 year-old.  Ok, sometimes I let him win but help him learn the strategy along the way.  This game has a nice box to store it in.  Tip: We sometimes set up the game inside the box end so that emptying it does not make a mess of the chips all over the table.  My cat sometimes sits in the other box end, lol.  Quick assembly before play.  A good way to pass the time instead of screen time.  Fun.
title: Great game

author: TeeCee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
review_content: Wow- I just received this and the box is beat up! I cannot give this as a gift!!!  Plastic torn, box scraped and missing chunks.. plus dirt/ etc inside the plastic.. seriously?!? So - someone picked this off the shelf- thought it looked good , and shipped it out?! Wow- that’s crappy service
title: Beat up! not able to give as gift now  .. seriously .. Who does this?

author: Deskafka
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: The game chips that came with this game do not match what is shown on the box, instead of smoothe  edges these chips had uncomfortable weird wavy edges. Nothing like I expected. I have had other Connect 4 games and none had weird wavy almost jagged edges like these.
title: Chips are not smoothe have wavy edges.

author: Amber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
review_content: Classic game but has a few issues.  First off, when I played as a kid, I'm pretty sure the pieces were black and red not yellow and red.  Therefore this does not feel like the old school game I grew up with.  Also, the entire game is make of cheap plastic, once again not like the sturdy game pieces I remember from the original.  All and all, good game for a good price.
title: It's ok

author: Hoppie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: My four y.o. grandson loves this game so much - we had to buy two.....one for my house and one for home to play with mom and dad.  Excellent visual learning game - teaches how to strategically place your pieces.  This kid of mine is a SHARK when it comes to games like this.  Highly recommend this game - kids don't need to be 6+ to play!
title: So much fun....we had to get two!

author: C. Harrington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2017
review_content: This is a great product. I was a little worried that I would receive a cheap knockoff from China, but this it the real thing. Thick plastic, not easily breakable or bendable, and the chip colors will not scratch off.
title: Nostalgiac and well built!

author: Susie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019
review_content: Connect 4 is a classic and the kids love it, but the plastic quality/ overall durability are worse than my childhood set.  The legs wobble and checkers are thin and lightweight.  You can't dump the board without using your other hand to stabilize it.  It is slightly smaller too and the legs feel like they might break after a few dozen assemblies.  Unfortunately, this lower level of quality seems to be the case with all the classic games I've purchased over the past few years.
title: Much worse than the old version, still very playable and fun

author: harmy10
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019
review_content: The game arrived in perfect condition and our kids love playing it.  Connect 4 is a game of skill that children and adults have enjoyed for many years.  It is the perfect two person game, and kids through teens love the competition, whether at home, school, or family gatherings.  Kids love to keep track of their "wins" and holding the title of "current champion."
title: The best and favorite game for kids and adults!

author: pigeonsalad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2017
review_content: I really like Connect 4, but I'd give this particular product three stars because it feels very flimsy. Children aren't likely to care, but I'd recommend a different set if this is the type of thing that bothers you. I've played with another set with this exact box design (which is why I purchased this), but that set was far sturdier. So perhaps I just got one made in a different country/factory, or maybe Hasbro just went with cheaper materials.
title: I really like Connect 4

author: Amazon Fan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2016
review_content: We bought this for our son for Christmas as a small gift since everything else was for his Wii U or Xbox 360. We like board games, and I figured this would be a cheap, easy gift for fun that would not require too much brain power... something we could play while watching a movie or something. I was so surprised at how much you need to use strategy! I easily won the first few games I played with my son (he's 10) but he caught on quick and now he consistently beat me (it's so embarrassing!!). We play best of 5 and it usually ends with "Good game Mommy. Better luck next time." Who knew! Simple set-up and easy clean up.
title: We like board games

author: MommaP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2016
review_content: This was the perfect gift for my daughters family at Christmas. Their children range in age from four years old to twelve years old and this game was one that everyone could play. The excitement of seeing the pieces slide into place was fun for the younger children and then to slide the bottom to begin another game was just as fun. This game has been around for many years and is just as much fun playing with my grandchildren as it was with my children. It is the exact same game and has not been changed from years ago ~ a fun experience for us all!
title: Fun, Exciting Game

author: Lil D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2018
review_content: Very disappointed as the side bar broke when taken out, the whole set looks cheaply made. I bought it for a road trip but have to return it. I usually trust Hasbro product, but not this one.
title: Very disappointed as the side bar broke when taken out

author: William Springer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
review_content: I mean, it's Connect 4. You almost certainly know what you're getting.I had previously purchased a nice wood Connect 4 set, but it had no way to release the checkers - you had to pick it up and turn it over, which defeats a big part of the fun (dropping all the checkers out after you win). This one is cheap and works well. Now if I can just get my 2-year-old to actually follow the rules...
title: It's Connect 4...

author: nr danilow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2013
review_content: The game is still fun but quality is not the same as it used to be. The slider doesn't work well (chips don't fall out at end of the game and you have to push them out), the chips are cheaper, the frame is lighter.  Overall, it is still a good game I just wish they still made it like they used to.The one we received is not travel sized in case you are worried about the reviewer who mentioned she did not get a full-sized version.The stated age range of this game is 6+ but my four-year old likes it (although he gets mad that I keep beating him, ha ha).  He totally gets the four in a row concept but is more interested in making four in a row than in stopping the opponent from getting four in a row (hence the reason I always win).  I have no doubt that he will get the hang of the strategy in no time and will be beating me :)My 2.5 year old likes to stick the chips in the frame.
title: Game still fun but much more cheaply made than when I was a kid

author: NYCMediaMix
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review_content: The game itself is a classic that can be played with little kids.  The build quality is ok but I believe older versions were built better.  For the price it does the job.  The legs stay in place as long as you don’t plan to move the game around too much after it is built.  The token release at the bottom of the game is very snug and takes a little work to move.
title: Good enough for the price

author: Amy O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: n/a. You know, it was a donation-etc. I think-hope they enjoy it. Thanks-gracias-world peace.Amazon is really great, wonderful, only thing is we still need the discount stores like dollar tree and keeping some kmarts- etc. Anyway thanks so much. Have a safe day. ( Also, more homeless shelters, re-hab/education, and/or re-location programs and jobs.)
title: thanks

author: Hoozier58
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2016
review_content: It is okay.  Serves the purpose as a decent game, but is definitely not the Connect Four I grew up with. Not nearly as sturdy as the game of old.  The locking mechanism at the base used to keep checkers in place constantly gets stuck.  As a result, I am sure it will eventually get broken.  Nevertheless, it is still a Connect Four game, and has given my children the same fun and entertainment it provided me 35 years ago.
title: SERVES THE PURPOSE

author: Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2019
review_content: I love connect 4, It's easy for little ones to pick up or just drop in the chips.  This version is very cheap in all ways.  The price can't be beat, but it's entirely plastic and definitely not made to last like the original.  I've had no issues with the game functioning, it just feels cheap.  Great for a quick gift to any kids 2 and up. My 2 year old just likes dropping the chips in and making them line up.
title: Super fun game, at a cheap price

author: QT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2016
review_content: This is an all time favorite game. I was even in a Dave's & Buster recently and they had a wall size version of this game and there was a line waiting to play it. A jumbo version of this game would be really cool. But, as for this game it is fun and challenging for all ages. Easy to assemble, simple to play. This is a game of strategy. I buy games that will build upon coordination skills, etc. So, this game fits right in perfectly. It is basically tic tac toe style of game, but you have to get four in a row rather than three.
title: An all time favorite game to play that requires you to strategized.

author: Native Idaho Nate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: Absolutely terrible box.  Will likely need to replace the box after 2-3 uses.Product quality is good, but games need a solid cardboard box to store them in.  This one fails miserably and loses stars.The game otherwise is functional and fun for kids to play.  If connect 4 was smart, they would bundle a checkers board with it as the pieces are the same and charge more!
title: Good game, absolutely cheap box to store it in.

author: SCMoose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: Great classic game that we are happy that Hasbro still makes. It is fun for all ages and compact enough to take with on a trip. Our 4 year old received for Christmas and he loves it and we all play it with him. Durable and well made, love the bright colors. Board games are still the best way to engage with family.
title: Durable and fun game for all. We recommend Connect 4

author: Kelly O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2016
review_content: I love this game as a simple turn taking activity for my preschool special ed classroom. We don't play by the rules until they are closer to five and better understand. The kids love it but I'd love to see a sturdier version (even it is a little pricer). They rarely last more than a year in the classroom. I also liked the older set up - the slide on the bottom of this one comes off too easily and often has to be put back on! Sitll love it!
title: Great activity for turn taking

author: Dianne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: After watching a commercial on TV, I thought my little 5 year old grandson, who has autism, may like to use this.  Not as a game, but as amusement.  He seems to like to study physical puzzles, just starting to used duplo blocks,  so think this might be right up his alley.  I could be wrong, but I  hope he's going to enjoy this.
title: It looks like something my autistic grandson would enjoy working with

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: So you might think by my picture I am complaining nope... Sure the pieces end up everywhere but this game distracts my son endlessly.He loves to search for the pieces and put them in, take them out and put them back in! Sure that's not how the game was intended to be played but I call this a win
title: Perfect!

author: MandSWinOK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2019
review_content: My 4-year-old grandson is just now learning how to predict multi-step consequences. Anticipating where each action you take will lead you is an important life skill and he loves it.We can't have it out when "his babies" (the 2-yr-old twins) are here so it's a special treat to play Connect 4...which sends X running to the closet where it "lives".Nothing like contraband to motivate use!
title: Great for teaching "what happens next".

author: Jaimie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I LOVED this game when I was younger so when I was thinking of games that my kids might like to try out this summer I thought of this one right away. It is easy to set up and it didn't take my kids (8 & 5) much time to learn it at all. They have a few games now and this one is one of their favorites. :)
title: Classic Fun!

author: Public Name
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017
review_content: I grew up in the 80s-90s and played Connect 4 as a kid. This is not the Connect 4 of my childhood! All of the plastic components are lighter and cheaper feeling. The new chips don't have the same texture as the old ones. The blue chip holder is very light. The box doesn't have a holder for any of the pieces anymore. It just doesn't feel like it's going to last through many years of play. Also, on a personal level, I hate the new box cover. It's trying way too hard.
title: It just doesn't feel like it's going to last through many years of play

author: Prez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
review_content: My old game broke years ago and this one is exactly like it and fun to play. It was easy to put together. (all the pieces are used, I almost threw away the slider to prevent the discs from falling) I put the discs in a baggie, so they aren't lost.  (I got one for friends too!)
title: It's as fun as you remember...

author: Leslie Curtin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: The game is made of cheap, flimsy plastic. It broke in less than a week. I saved the checkers but the rest was junk.I replaced it with another company’s wooden version.Don’t waste your money.
title: Cheap plastic

author: Kaitlyn T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: I liked that the price for this product was very reasonable. I bought it for my 4 year old daughter, and she loves it! It’s a nice game for her to be able to play with her older sisters or with everyone as a family taking turns. Would purchase again for a gift for someone else in the future.
title: Nice gift

author: A. Howard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
review_content: The game itself seems good, but the cardboard box is thin and was severely damaged in shipping.  Not a big deal for me, since it was purchased for our family and will be put in a smaller bag, anyway (the box is huge compared to the game), but if it was intended as a gift, it would not have been presentable.
title: Great for travel, but damaged box

author: Nutsnbolts24
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: My wife and I recalled this from our childhood. It went together well, is easy to put in and out of the box and a simple entertaining game for the kids. Best part it requires NO batteries! It is sometimes suprising how much fun the kids can have with a simple game, I admit I wasn't sure they would halt the Xbox or Playstation for it. My ears sure like it when they do. ;)
title: Fun simple game

author: G.C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
review_content: There’s not much else to say. You open the box and assemble the plastic Connect 4 thingy and then play. I was upset that my boyfriend connected 4 before me, but such is life. Sometimes you connect 4, sometimes 4 connects you. You have to disassemble the plastic thingy if you want to store it in the box. So basically everything was as expected. The end.
title: I mean, it’s Connect 4

author: cd77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2016
review_content: I bought this connect 4 game for my son. He found my old Connect 4 in the closet and really had fun with it. The new one gets the same thing accomplished as mine did from the 80's, but the quality has diminished. These things are very cheaply made. My old one had real checkers and the plastic was thick and durable. This new game has very thin plastic and thin plastic tokens to use instead of checkers. It has held up fine though.
title: Ok, but not like it used to be.

author: Brianne Martinez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: I grew up playing this game as a child in school and it was a favorite amongst the students. We would always challenge each other and see who would win. We would win prizes sometimes from the teacher. I wanted to bring that fun experience home for my nephews and they love it too!
title: A classic

author: Coyote
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: This was a last minute buy because of the price - and because my nieces and nephews love board games. The surprise was when the adults gathered around the table on Christmas Eve to engage in a battle of wits. We had a lot of fun. Best 5 bucks I ever spent.
title: Old Games are the best games

author: Keith R. Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
review_content: It's the classic game, but the runner along the bottom (to keep the checkers in place) is cheap and broke fairly easily. Not a good toy for a toddler (which is who we got the game for) since they will be rougher than average.
title: made from cheap plastic

author: AudaciousMe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2018
review_content: The game is perfectly fun, no problem there. Three year old likes it. For the price it's a good product. The plastic frame is light weight hard plastic. Easy to knock over for young players and brittle plastic. So if you're not looking for long term durability, Its great.
title: Fun, not built for long term durability

author: JDC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2018
review_content: Classic game at a great price. Easy to set up and play. Easy to tank apart and store. My 5 year old hates it because I refuse to let him win. The only thing I find annoying is that the box isn't quite square. It never fails that when I go to pack it up I end up needing to rotate the lid 90 degrees to get the box closed. No big deal - just thought I would mention that - since there isn't really much else to talk about. It's connect 4 - it works!
title: Classic game at a great price...

author: VSquared
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: This is pretty flimsy and difficult to put together which you will have to do every time in order to put it away in its box. Not something I thought about or considered. I've played other sets that were more durable. Disappointed, but it was really inexpensive.
title: Get what you pay for

author: LANCE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: One of my all time favorite games as a kid. Still the same wonderful game. Problem is, the chips look and feel different- they feel cheaper and more flimsy. But it’s still the same game, and brings back childhood memories.
title: Chips are less quality than old chips

author: Sb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
review_content: I have been looking for games for my 3.5 year old to play with him. He picked this up pretty quickly and it’s been a lot of fun to play with him. The quality of the board isn’t the greatest but it isn’t terrible either. It’s perfect for playing with a 3 year old and definitely for the price I paid.
title: So much fun

author: Sid26
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: Such a fun game to play with kids and also adults. My 7 yr old has almost mastered it. My 5 yr old just like placing coins in and out, doesn’t understand the game well. Fun game overall even i and my hubby enjoy playing.
title: Such fun game

author: Carmen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: Don't let the little kids play with since the game comes apart in 4 pieces.  they broke the slide piece but we makeshifted it to work.  The kids can play together and they really enjoy watching them fall out when done.
title: Great game

author: Theo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2017
review_content: heard a lot of bad reviews from old timers like myself.none from me.the product is well designed and works beautifully.lever at the bottom to hold the chips in place worked flawlessly.chips slid down each column with no effort and emptied quickly.all in all, it is a well designed game at a very reasonable price.i'm very satisfied with it and my grand-daughter loved it.
title: hasbro connect 4 game

author: B. Sanders
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2016
review_content: I had this game as a child and purchased it for my son (age 6) as part of his Christmas gifts. He loves it! It seems a little flimsier than it did when I was a kid, but we have had no problems with it.  The best part is that you can play a few games together in a relatively quick time frame.  It is nice to be able to spend a little quality time playing a game before dinner on a weeknight.  Easy for kids to learn to play, easy set up and clean up and my son thinks it's really fun!
title: Great classic game!

author: Simon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: Classic connect 4, what's not to like? Only 4 stars though because theh obviously thinned everything from the game we had as kids, most noticeably the "coins". Nothing wrong with it, all fully functional, just not as high quality
title: Classic connect 4, cant go wrong

author: Melody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019
review_content: I ordered this assuming it would be a cheapy because of the price, turns out it is a goo done!! easy assembly all pieces present. I'm  family game night and this is his favorite, granted he insists I make 5 in a row and he makes 4 lol. the overall quality of the game items were much better than I expected and very durable.
title: PERFECT GAME NIGHT

author: Love4Music
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: Played this game in the 80's when I was a kid. This isn't quite how I remember it. This one is cheaply made, and the checkers aren't like they used to be. They are different colors now and look a bit cheesy. Much easier to break than the original from the 80's. A bit disappointed. :-(
title: Nothing Stays The Same

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: Bought this game for my 7 and 5 year old, and I love that it’s such an easy game for them to engage in together without assistance. Really good for fine motor skills, creative thinking, and problem solving.
title: Great game for kids

author: Sharon K. Chapman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
review_content: My granddaughter brought the game to my house to play. I loved it so ordered one for my house.  I keep it on my table to play when guests come over.  So easy and fun to play but can lose in a flash too....many laughs.
title: Easy game to play with surprising results.

author: Marylou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
review_content: We got this for Christmas for my 5 year old daughter and she loves it just as much as I did when I was a kid! We're so happy with our purchase! It's good quality and going to provide tons of family fun for years to come!
title: Fun with the kids!

author: Angela
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: We had the small travel version(2 of them) for a long time but I have wanted to get the bigger one for a while. Like it a lot! The travel ones are neat because you can catch the pieces at the bottom and they are stored on the sides but I like the bigger one.
title: Classic...

author: jayh1528
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2016
review_content: I bought this game to use during our monthly game nights and as soon as its arrival has become a great addition to our families game night collection. I am very impressed with how quickly the product arrived at my house and even more pleased with the cost as well! I now often play connect 4 with my niece because this has quickly become her favorite game to play and she loves playing against the other people in our household on a weekly basis.I definately give it 5 stars! Thank you for providing a product that has provided our family hours of fun time and togetherness.
title: Great product, fun for the whole family, great price

author: Joan D. Shupp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: My husband inadvertently threw away one of the support pieces, which appeared to be a part of the throw away plastic. Therefore, the pieces fall through. I tried to contact the company by information on the box and internet, wanting to buy a replacement piece, but couldn't get anyone to answer me. Disappointed.
title: Dissatisfied.

author: Nina O. Van Cooney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
review_content: My students love this game.  The younger generation needs to learn to play board games, or games like this one, to help them with thinking outside the box and using strategies to reach their goal.  There is too much technology in their lives and they are not thinking for themselves.  If technology can't readily give them the information, they usually don't want anything to do with it.
title: My students love this game

author: D. Campisi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2016
review_content: Very good game.  It seems just like the version of the game I had back in the 80s.  My son and I started playing this game when he was about 6, and it was good for him to learn a bit of basic strategy.  My 2-year-old daughter has taken to playing with it now too.  She loves to fill it up with all the little checkers... then watch them all drop when I pull the lever.  She just loves it.  Great game.
title: A classic

author: Joee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: All of the kids I know love this game, and it is simple enough for almost any age to learn and play. And adults have fun with it as well!  This a a great classic that I grew up adoring myself as a kid, and should probably be a part of any good children's game collection.  Help beat those stay at home blues with Connect Four!
title: A classic! Hard to go wrong

author: Eponine16
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020
review_content: Fantastic game. I love playing with the kids and the kids love it too. I wouldn't recommend it for traveling unless you don't plan to play it until you get to your destination. I think it would be too easy to lose pieces.
title: Awesome game

author: Jack Moodie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_content: The box was fully sealed from the manufacturer and appeared to be brand new.  Once the package was opened for our grandson on Christmas morn, it was discovered the contents of the game was vastly incomplete.  Less than half the pieces needed to play were enclosed in the box.  Poor quality control Hasbro!!
title: Incomplete packaging by Hasbro

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2016
review_content: Love the game, but sure miss the product quality.  At least this set breaks down easily for storage.  Perfect for our family game nights.  Love that this game is multi-functional for preschool preschool play - just check Pinterest for some ideas of incorporating math/spelling or other learning into the game.
title: So many Pinterest ideas to incorporate

author: Gina F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: This is pretty much your basic connect four game. Its not too big and a little less sturdy than the ones that I used to play with as a kid, however, the price is right for the product. And it is a good product.
title: It’s connect 4

author: pjs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my grandchildren. They love games and they really enjoy this! They are too young to understand the rules, but they enjoy putting the red and yellow "coins" in the slots. It is sturdy and easy to put together.
title: Fun!

author: CMPAZ1951
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: The grand kids LOVE this game.  Ages 7 and almost 4 and they picked it up quick and they had a blast playing together.  Small enough it will travel well and doesn't take up much room in their game closet.  Highly recommend.
title: Classic game lots of fun

author: Pinklinks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
review_content: Just bought this. It arrived with only 20 red disc only and 21 yellow disc.  This missing one disc.  Otherwise great game.I didn’t want to have to return it.  I wish they had options where you can buy more disc
title: Missing a red disc

author: Erika
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019
review_content: I purchased this game for my 10 yr old grandson.  He had never played before.  It did not take long for him to figure it out!  He had a great time beating just about everyone t the birthday party.  Now he and my son play frequently.
title: Grandkids loved  the game

author: G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
review_content: It's the classic, fun.  The lock that keeps the tiles in place while playing can sometimes get a little stuck, or can sometimes open by a little table shake.  A minor thing since it's not most of the time.
title: Fun Game

author: WEAPONX
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: this was so cheaply made.  it will fall apart on you almost instantly.  not designed for kids because its not sturdy at all.  Not like the old games we used to have.  the plastic is too think to hold up.
title: cheaply made

author: BOOKLOVER
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
review_content: Young grandchildren put this together and take it apart and put it away every visit.  From 2 to 12 it's held up well despite the low cost.  It seems flimsy, but it really is just fine.
title: Good

author: terry S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: I purchased this for my 5 year old Granddaughter. She loved the interaction with Grandma & Grandpa, and provided education in colors and numbers. She wanted to play it again and again.
title: Grandmother purchased

author: Terrance
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: Look we're all stuck inside and getting board. Super easy to set up and literally no rules to the game except you need to get 4 in a row in any direction. It is what it is. So make it fun. Be safe in 2020.
title: Played same day as delivery. Super fun!

author: l. r.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
review_content: Great old fashioned game!  Kids love it, great price!  Could be used for travel but it might be a problem when you release the chips at the end of the game, would have to have the stand in the box top to catch the pieces. Better travel games out there.
title: Fun game

author: Sophie B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
review_content: This game is a classic and keeps kids and adults entertained.  Only qualm is I wish they gave extra tokens because they can get lost easily and set doesn't come with a pouch for safe keeping
title: Fun for the kids and whole family

author: Teri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: Same old game, who doesn't like connect 4? I purchased it becuse my son is really into board games and he did not have this one yet. The price was great and I'm sure our family will enjoy it for years to come. Family Game Night Carry On!!
title: An oldy but a goody!

author: R. McClellan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
review_content: Bought this to play with my grandchildren, 9 and 7 years old. We had a lot of fun and they were learning how to look at the big picture and strategize. We alternated players and the one waiting their turn was entertained by watching and thinking about what they would do.
title: Fun

author: cosmo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: Remember connect four? I got this for my kids and they love it just as much did. My little man want to play connect four with ma as soon as I get home. I have to admit I love playing it with him too.
title: Who doesn’t love connect four?

author: MeteorMik
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
review_content: Talk about simple to learn but a lot more strategy than one would think to win.  I told my wife to take this game with her for a weekend with her girlfriends.  She laughed at me but took it. It anyway. It was the hit of the weekend. Her friends had so much fun playing it they all bought one when they got home. Great for entire family.
title: I Love This Game

author: HonestReviews101
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
review_content: Sooooo much fun! Friends and family cant stop playing any time anyone is over. The simplicity yet mild concentration & intelligence needed for this makes it a perfect game for everyone at any mood.
title: An adult version tic tac toe

author: The Godfather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2016
review_content: This is a good game to play with a child.  It is simple in its concept.  Each player drops the chips into the slots in an effort to have four in a row vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, while also placing chips to stop the opponent from achieving the connection.  Bought this for my grandkids to play.
title: Easy to play

author: Shop4deals
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: My son and I love connect four.  It’s a two player game, where the player who gets 4 of their color checkers in a row first-wins. It’s a pretty quick game so it keeps kids entertained. It’s on the top of our list on game night.
title: Fun game that adults can enjoy too.

author: Igneyris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: What can I say about this game? I loved it growing up (Master level) and now my son does too! I have many board games at home & every Saturday is game night. Connect 4 is a way to simulate the brain as well! Welcome to the family connect 4!
title: Connect 4

author: A. Pavon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: Classic game, easy for kid's of any age to lrarn. Or even if they are too young to actually play it's great fine motor work for really little ones to put the pieces into the game and fill up the board.
title: Classic game for a reason, everybody loves playing

author: Elizabeth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: My 2 yo loves this. He loves dropping the pieces in. It's a very easy game to playing with a toddler to teach them to count (connect 1, 2, 3, 4!). We have to hide it otherwise he would insist that we play it non stop.
title: 2 yo cant stop playing it

author: Drea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2015
review_content: If I could rate it a zero stars I would, this is NOT made with quality in mind. It is not like the connect 4 I grew up with, this is cheaply made thin and not sturdy. The bar on the bottom the slides is horrible, thin comes off the tracks. The rest of the game is just as cheaply made not the thicker sturdy material I was expecting. My boy would not understand getting a different one since Santa brought it so I can't really return it in hopes to getting an old model that is sturdy.Although the game itself is still fun.
title: Thin and cheaply made, not made like the original sturdy ones

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: I bought all the games and toys to donate for children whom would not have gotten Christmas presents.  Amazon makes it so easy to help less fortunate kids!  ty Amazon
title: Bought games for kids

author: Norry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
review_content: Having fun playing against 5 year old granddaughter. Have yet to finish a game because the 2 year old grandson loves to watch the chips fall out of it when he slides the release.
title: 5 star

author: Nes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: Product was affordable, but not not quality. The bottom piece to prevent the checkers(whatever you call them) from falling out when dropped in was not within the inventory, so we had to use tape.Its too cheaply made. Be careful. We learned a lesson on saving a dollar or two.
title: Affordable but no quality

author: SBell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: I had forgotten how much I love playing this game!  My 5 year old loves it, and my husband and I occasionally grab it and play a couple of quick games.  This was a big hit this year for Christmas.
title: Great game!!!

author: Jen Matrisciano
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
review_content: A family fun game to play anywhere! We took the box in our backpack when we flew on a plane for 3 hours and it was perfect fun for the 3 of us to pass some time. I bought it on a great sale and it was definitely worth it!
title: Family fun from children to adults

author: j
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
review_content: Why in the world doesn’t the box show the pieces that need to be saved?The  slider bar got thrown away and now we can’t use the set.So easy to have happen.
title: Pieces that need to be saved.

author: H.Thor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019
review_content: Bought this for my five year old for Christmas and he enjoys it quite a bit, as does the rest of the family. It is a great game for all ages and teaches some valuable lessons in planning ahead and focusing on the matter at hand. Would recommend for younger kids as a gift, but rest assured, the older ones will enjoy playing it as well.
title: Easy to learn and hard to master (for the kids at least)

author: Ohme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2017
review_content: This was for a granddaughter, who turned six.  Her mom says she gets a little frustrated when she gets beaten, but is so excited when she wins (her parents and siblings are compassionate players).  Momma thought this might help teach her logic and thought processing... she's pretty sharp and I think it will be an excellent strategy game.  She enjoys tic-tac-toe, so this should be great.  The ordering and delivery process was, as usual, amazing.  Thank you, Amazon!
title: she's pretty sharp and I think it will be an excellent ...

author: Tisha Nickerson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
review_content: My 4 yr old cheats .. lol when he is not winning he opens the bottom to release all the peices.  Other than that its a great game for him and his 6yr old sister
title: Kid cheats, great game tho!

author: Mika D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
review_content: Still as awesome as it ever was. There is no bag to keep the chips in, so I recommend a sandwich bag that you can reuse for storage within the box. That way pieces will not get lost as quickly. My kid got the concept of the game when she was 3, so if you are looking for a game for a younger child that is NOT Candy Land, then this will do fine.
title: Kids under 5 can play.

author: Sam Levy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2015
review_content: The game says 6+ and i bought it for our 3.5 y.o. - it looks like it will take him a while before getting it... for now he understands that you can build (4) or block. This is not the reason for the 3* review.Both the great and the chips look cheap. I recall a more sturdy material. Also the system to empty the grid used to be a strong swing, it is now a weak swipe.
title: Feels very cheap material

author: MaryKate5
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
review_content: Connect 4------5*It's a classic game. What can you say? Snap the pieces together and start playing. My 7yo daughter and I went right to a tournament. Yes, I won.
title: Great game for families

author: Peter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
review_content: What a wonderful classic game.  Easy to learn and easy to teach.  I play it with my 6 year old daughter who is also hooked.  The game is plastic and easy to assemble.  My daughter was able to do it without any help from me.  Seems to be decent quality, especially for the price.
title: Classic!

author: SM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2017
review_content: Excellent product. I and my 6yrs old daughter enjoy playing with it. I was very surprised to know that my daughter could come up with her own strategies to win in the game and it keeps her interested in the game. The toy is made with good quality plastic except for the stand which is wiggly sometimes.
title: Hours of fun for my 6yrs old daughter.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2018
review_content: I bought this game because I have two nephews (5 and 7) and I needed something to keep them entertained and away from the TV and Ipad. I like this game because it's a good strategy game and it makes them think while also having fun. There is no age limit so the whole family can play.
title: Awesome Game

author: Bret R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: The Connect Four game is a solid game as always, unfortunately this new version just doesn't have the quality of the old versions.  It does work though and is a fun game.
title: Fun game as always, quality has gone down.

author: Nick Millender
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: While alot of games from childhood have gone cheap and cheesy. This one holds up pretty well with my kids. Fun classic game at a price that won't break the bank.
title: Same great Connect 4!

author: Jennifer K5
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2015
review_content: I loved this game as a kid and so was happy to find they still make it.  I ordered it for my daughter.  The plastic is very thin and flimsy and doesn't have a good heft as you drop the pieces.  Worst of all, it arrived missing the legs and bottom piece that holds the checkers in the grid, so as excite d as my daughter was, we couldn't use it.  The premise of the game is still sound, but this set is cheap. We are probably going to try to find an older set rather than re-ordering a new crappy, flimsy one.
title: They don't make em like they used to...

author: Early Intervention OT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
review_content: It is great to find a game that appeals to kids of all ages - from 2 years and up.  It is based on tic-tac-toe concept but can be used with one-to-one supervision for younger kids to improve fine motor/visual-motor skills, color sorting, and counting.  Great occupational therapy activity for traveling therapists!
title: Simple, fun & inexpensive game for the whole family!

author: Party of 7
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: I had this game when I was little and now I’ve purchased it for my five-year-old granddaughter. I know she’ll love it. Can’t go wrong with a classic!
title: Classic game!

author: Jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2019
review_content: This was a great game when I was a kid, and it is still today. Great lightweight game to take on trips, and is fun for all ages.My family had a little game Marathon which kept the kids off their phones for awhile which was ideal. Great price at Amazon too!
title: This game brought back my childhood memories

author: Kristal Walker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
review_content: I love this game. My husband and I play with our 11 year old. Yes, even as a preteen she loves it too. My younger nieces ages 5 and 9 love playing too. The 5 year old does need some help and suggestions, but she has a great time. I am tempted to buy one more so the kids don't have to wait to take turns.
title: Preteens love it too.

author: Rider16
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
review_content: Our child is highly competitive, but this game goes quickly and strategy can be discussed and he does get some aspects of it. its a very nice way to spend time together.
title: Great for a 4 year old

author: A. Sansguiri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
review_content: I can’t believe how much my 6-year old nephew loves this game.  At home he’s playing video games and watching tv, but when he comes over he pulls this out and sets it up.  Good strategy game that doesn’t take forever.  The quality is great and you can’t beat the price.
title: A classic

author: Sharita Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: Nice. Kids love it.
title: Nice game for the family to pass the time away..

author: Rubie Grace
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: One of my kids favorite games!  They always have fun playing and it is good for developing strategy skills.  We think this is a great addition to the toy closet.  Seems durable enough.  Makes a great gift, too.
title: Excellent

author: Peter T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
review_content: Pore quality
title: Not made how they used to be

author: Wilson Yu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020
review_content: My kids love playing this game! They've been playing it nearly every day from the day I bought it! It easy to learn how to play and a really fun game!
title: So fun!

author: Matthew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
review_content: We already had a Connect Four game from the 90s, but the box was wide and awkward for our bookshelf. This game is pretty cheap so we went ahead and ordered this version as a replacement, and it is nice to have a more conveniently packaged one for our game shelves.
title: Convenient size of the original game

author: Prepper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: Played with it for two days with my four year old grandson.  We played as suggested, changed the game rules and scenarios and used the tokens to stack and build with too!  He loves it!
title: Simple but very good game for four year olds and up

author: Max™
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2014
review_content: This is a very fun toy for all in the family, even little kids enjoy playing with it. The plastics used is rather light weight but on the positive side they don't have any funny smells. After all, these are still made in USA.Given the typical price this is sold, I fully understand why the materials are very light weight (not heavy duty). However, it is still a very good value and a toy I recommend for everyone who likes to have some non-computer, non-electric toys once in a while. It is excellent for taking on camping trips, too.
title: Great toy still made in USA.

author: Myat H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
review_content: This is one of the best classic game that suits young children. This version is a tiny bit filmsy but can't complaint given the price. It's light weight and portable; great for road trips.
title: Hasbro Game

author: rosemary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
review_content: Came in a small enough box that you can definitely travel with it and watching the kids eyes light up when they saw it was priceless.
title: It was a gift

author: Abby Gut
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: My mom grew up playing this game, she passed it on to me when I was little, and now my brother is obsessed. He started playing as young as 2-3 which we saw to be helpful for him with counting and recognizing patterns. This game is a classic for any age!
title: Passed down from generations!

author: Tony C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: Just getting games for my kids that I remember from my childhood. It seems a little different, but in all it is still the same game.
title: Fun Game

author: Printed Unlimited
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: Great family game for all ages. Good quality and value. We play it with our 5 and 3 year old often. They never want to stop playing it. Not practical for travel.
title: We play it with our 5 and 3 year old often.

author: Leah Mccabe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: I love getting new games for the colder months in MN, I'm a bargain shopper and look at all stores before buying so when I got the notice on the price drop I bought it.
title: Family must have

author: K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: This game Is a classic. Got a good price on Amazon so will be gifting us it’s our kids for Christmas. Can’t wait to play with them
title: Classic game for all ages

author: Bexxy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: So much fun watching my Grandkids play.  It helps with focus and counting as well as strategies. Came fast and packaged well. Very giftable
title: Great value

author: Casey Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
review_content: This is your classic version of connect 4. I am a teacher and my students still love playing this just as much as I did as a kid. Sets up and cleans up in seconds. Highly recommended!Please click the "Helpful" button below if you read this review!
title: Your Classic Version Of Connect 4!!

author: Angela Mason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
review_content: I bought this for my 3 year old and 5 year old to encourage them to play together, rather than fighting over toys. It is just like I remembered it as a kid! The only thing I don't like is that you have to take the legs off the board to get it back in the box. Not a problem for me, but when they kids want to play or I ask them to put it away, they struggle to do it on their own. Otherwise, great product!
title: Nostalgia!

author: singhsongs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2017
review_content: I am building up my game closet. This game isn’t cheap feeling like a version I got from the store years ago. The plastic that makes the frames and the chips are high quality. I was missing a few chips, but I figured that was because I bought this as an open box.
title: Fun Classic

author: kathy crabtree
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: I bought this item for my grandson and he loves it! The game was easy for him to learn. I felt the checker pieces were not very durable. Very lightweight, but not too bad.
title: Connect 4 Game

author: The Natural
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019
review_content: The legs and slider feel cheaper, but who knows maybe they were like that in 1988 too.  Once you get it put together it works just how it should and is a great game for young minds.  A must have for every young kids game collection.
title: Cheaper feeling, but it works

author: TaCro
