date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: Love these games. These were a staple of our childhood and I'm glad they are still for sale on Amazon so we can share them with our little cousins and nieces and nephews
title: Family fun

author: Sherri in Georgia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: This classic game is great fun to teach the grand boys. Although it is plastic it doesn’t feel flimsy. The parcel arrived on time and in good condition.
title: Good Fun

author: Nikki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: My kids and I play this. My girls are 10 and 12. It’s never boring and the more they play the better they get. Keeps them entertained for quite awhile.
title: Fun

author: Anu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: This is a wonderful game. It is easy to learn and a great way to connect with kids and adults alike. Must have for any family & friend get-togethers or parties.
title: Great game for kids and adults alike

author: Raissa Young
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020
review_content: Granddaughter approved. This is a beautiful game for entertaining children and even adults. Easy to learn and it’s giftable
title: Great Connect-4 game for 3 and up

author: JaLo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
review_content: I bought this as a brain exercise for a friend who had an accident and was recovering from a TBI.  Also good game for kids
title: Recommend

author: krystyl_rose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_content: Though the packaging is significantly different than I remember growing up, the game "board" is still just as good of quality.  My kids now love playing the same games I grew up with.
title: New Packaging, Same Great Game

author: opinionchick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
review_content: arrived quickly, we LOVE playing this old school game - there are ongoing competitions. we have the original version from years ago that we have at another location that we also use that is not as well designed as this one, obviously. great for adults while relaxing and having a drink, it becomes challenging. heard of another great game that has multiple x and o combos that I want to get, made out of wood.
title: love this game, it arrived quickly, this is an upgraded version of the original

author: ERiv
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: My kids love to play this! I used to play as a child so it brings back memories. It’s the same quality as it’s always been. Not any better, but not worse. We have a lot of fun playing it.
title: Fun to Play with the Kids

author: tamethetime
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2018
review_content: I miss older games that were sturdy and made to last. This came to me in flimsy pieces and was nothing like the ones from the 80s-90s. I do not think it will last due to the low quality of the plastic frame pieces. The game itself is still fun but I feel I wasted money on this one due to the cheap quality.
title: Get a vintage one to last!

author: Efrain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018
review_content: Most everything is good about this childhood game. My only critique would be the release lever. It sometimes sticks and won’t allow release of the game pieces. But otherwise, this game can provide hours of entertainment for kids and adults alike.
title: Nastalgia to childhood, fun game, hours of entertainment, fairly sturdy

author: LULU
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020
review_content: Right size and price.  My son and I enjoy playing with it. Can bring for traveling. Easy to release the chips on the bottom with a slide.  No need to flip upside down.
title: Love it!

author: Alex F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: We use it for a couple's therapy lol.Each time me and my wide disagree on something we go play a quick Connect 4 and whoever wins gets to decide lol.
title: Awesome game

author: PrimeAddict
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: Got this for a great price when it went on price drop, join us, PRIME ADDICT on facebook to not miss another deal!
title: LOVE IT!

author: David Price
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: Still have it 5 years later. Good fun game, that’s easy to play with family and friends. The plastic isn’t as durable as one made years ago but it still holds up well.
title: Great game to connect with people

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
review_content: Great quick game. We use games to decide things like- winner picks the movie, or, looser does the dishes... fun!
title: Great easy quick game..

author: Lisa J.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
review_content: This game was definately used, parts were already taken apart and there was no box at all. It came as a connect 4 game on my porch wrapped in raggedy celophane wrap. You gotta be kidding me.
title: Not what I expected.

author: em
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: Can't go wrong with this game. My son who gets super competitive loves this old classic game. Glad I found it for this price compare to other places that will try and sale it for more then it's worth.
title: Worth the price

author: zach holly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
review_content: I gave this to my nine year old niece and she loved it!  It is nice to get away from the screens we stare at all day and play something like this.
title: What a classic!

author: Jackson Ly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
review_content: Pros:-all pieces included and work properlyCon: two plastic pieces on sides dont really hold it up securely enough, cheaper quality than i remember as a kidBut still loads of fun and cant really complain at this price
title: Lots of fun

author: adnan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: My sons love playing this when they can't have find anything else to have fun with. It is easy to learn and can last a long time if all the pieces are put back in the box after playing!
title: Fun Board Game

author: Christine A. George
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: This game was delivered quickly. It is of great quality and the children in my family have not destroyed it yet. Definitely great for the price, get yours today!!
title: Hasbro Connect Four

author: Micco Daniels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
review_content: Love this game. The pieces feel very good in the hands, and everything feels sturdy and durable. I carry it around in my backpack in case I want to play with someone, so it’s portable too.
title: Easily worth the money

author: Lindenheart
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
review_content: This was a last-minute Christmas present. I'm so glad I went with my gut. Having the family over for the holidays, there was a constant "I play winner" going on. From 4 yrs old to 64 yrs young, every one had a blast playing.
title: Classic game, instant hit

author: Jackelyn Alvarado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: The fact that it is not too big is nice. However, the leg parts always fall off during the game, which is extremely frustrating (after I've double check the legs are locked in place).  I wouldn't buy it again because of that.
title: Okay product

author: Aaron R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: Fun for all ages!  Bit frustrating getting beat by my 8 year old 8 out of 10 times.  That's what's fun about it. Anyone can win.
title: Fun for all

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
review_content: This is a classic game and simple for all to use. I bought this for an acquaintance to help with school. I have seen some educators use them for counting, matching (by placing pictures on them or numbers) and a variety of other uses.
title: Hasbro Connect 4

author: Heather Y. Atwood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_content: I like gifting games for Toys for tots, this is one that is easy to play - Tic Tac ToeTake care of the pieces as they can get lost easily
title: Gift for the Toys for Tots box

author: Meg B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019
review_content: We get a game every year for Christmas. This was a huge hit this year! My 5yo played against ever member of the family. It was so great to share something we loved from our childhood with him, and see how much he enjoyed it. Grandpa got pretty into it too;)
title: Must have classic

author: Pen Name
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: Wish I would have bought this game sooner. My 5 year old loves it and it’s a great addition to our game collection!!
title: Great game

author: AK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2019
review_content: Wanted to give this 0 stars bc of how much time you waste playing this over and over again.. It is so much fun, my 4 yo picked it up and now it's a game she wants to play non stop... They need to make this less addictive
title: Connect 4 and shut the door

author: SanDiegoMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: much cheaper version of the original. they have cut so many corners on these old games. Cheap plastic. Flimsy. Wish they would make them like they used to
title: cheap flimsy

author: Mike V
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
review_content: My 4 year old and I like to play this game. It's a great starter game. She didn't get it at first and really just liked putting the pieces in. But because the games are so short, we can play over and over again and now she's understanding the game. Great introduction game.
title: Great quick game

author: DHelen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
review_content: My 2,5 yo loves to play with it. Very entertaining and great to start learning about turn to play/psicomotor skills.
title: Happy

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: I got it as a gift for my 6 year old nephew that has had pretty much every kind of toy. This game was half the price of the ones on display at Wal-Mart. He unwrapped his present and immediately started playing. He said he loved it. Great gift and great buy!
title: Great gift!

author: Elizabeth W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
review_content: Got this for my brother girlfriends kids that I don’t like. Now the ask me to play with them every time I come over. Maybe I should have gotten something else but it was cheap and they enjoy it. It also doesn’t take long to play
title: Fun to play

author: Rebaperson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: Grandson plays it much with his therapist, because he sometimes wins.  Consistently likes also to play it with me; it always surprises.
title: Dependable enjoyment, very simple

author: Vendetta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_content: Checkers feel thinner/cheaper than before.  So does the rack...  but that's the Hasbro/Walmart effect, so at least it's only 8 bucks.  I'd pay double for a "premium" one made more like they did back in the 80s.
title: Cheaper materials make it feel thinner/lighter, but that's the way of things now I guess...

author: R Landers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: It feels cheaper than I remember from playing it as a kid but that was 25 years ago. My kids don’t know the difference. They like it.
title: They don’t make ‘em like they used to.

author: Bkong2000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: This game is good for all ages.  I am happy with this product.  I want the kids to play this game instead of iPad.  The good thing is they like to  challenge each other.
title: Family game

author: A. Dachton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: The assortment of card games is great for kids.  I play them with my 4 year old grandson.  Brightly colored cards with artwork that appeals to kids.
title: Nice Combination of Card Games for Kids

author: Kimmy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
review_content: Different quality from my childhood but same concept. If only quality remained the same. It seems flimsy now.
title: Different quality

author: HappyMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
review_content: The game was prefect. It was a hit with the kids even my three year old loved the game. Packaging was spot on all the pieces where included. Great game for the kids
title: Great game

author: Jenna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2017
review_content: Connect four is the best and is easy to set up. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I was super sad to see how much lower quality the parts are than they were when I was a kid. The red and yellow pieces are super flimsy but it doesn't take away from it still being a great game!
title: Affordable and lots of fun!

author: Vanilla_hobbit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019
review_content: I forgot how much fun this was, I bought it for my niece for her birthday, she absolutely loved it, it seems like we played it for several hours.

author: fruitcake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2016
review_content: I bought two of these for centers in my classroom. I wrote numbers on each set of pieces and the kids play to reach 10, 15, or 20. It teaches them math fact fluency and it teaches them strategy because as much as they are trying to win by getting to 10 first, they have to pay attention to what their opponent is doing, because they need to anticipate their moves and block them when needed. Brilliant. I got the idea from the "brown bag teacher" blog. :)
title: Bought for my classroom

author: Larry Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2014
review_content: When my children were young, we had a Connect 4 and the kids loved playing the game.  There is a certain way to play the game, and kids of all ages will like this game.  I take it to the lunch room and play a few rounds before lunch.  It is great because anyone can play the game, and all learn its strategies quickly.  For a small investment, I promise you'll enjoy Connect 4 and play it with the grandchildren when they come over!!
title: This game is great for kids of ALL ages.

author: Hollie Morales
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2016
review_content: Basic Connect 4 game. We've had it a little more than a month now and nothing is broken yet so I'd say it is pretty well made. Tokens are thick plastic and everything fits together smoothly. Legs come off easily to store game back in the box but don't fall off if you pick the game up. The release lever sometimes sticks and you have to shake it to get the tokens on the ends to fall through the bottom but that's ok. My only wish would be for the legs to be connected from side to side so that it would form a fall zone to keep the tokens from scattering all over the place when the tokens are released.
title: still a great classic game with no bells and whistles.

author: Benjamin Lockwood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2014
review_content: The gameplay of connect 4 is excellent but I have to rate this current Hasbro version of the game poorly because of the quality of the pieces. I imagine everyone already knows how to play connect 4.The pieces in this version, despite some of the pictures, are smooth-edged and not notched. Therefore they cannot be stacked and will make a mess when they are strewn about your boss's desk at work. In contrast, the older "Milton Bradley" version has notched edges which make it possible to stack the pieces and save space!
title: Beware: Non-stackable game pieces

author: Nicholas Stock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2014
review_content: I remember playing this as a kid...the set was of a heavy construction with a swinging hinge and the pieces were hefty and solid. It would appear that Hasbro are trying to milk as much as they can out of as little plastic as they can. You can still play the game, but compared to the sets of yesteryear, this is a cheap rip-off in my opinion. Oh well, I suppose that's economics for you.....
title: Capitalism in action...

author: Yuko Yoshimura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2014
review_content: This game is so simple and so fun! I play with my 8 yr old and 10 yr old daughters and... I win some but... believe it or not, I lose some!The great thing about it for me is that you don't need to understand English to enjoy this game. I have many friends in Japan who visit me with their kids. I'm always thinking how my kids can have fun together with the kids who don't speak any English. Well, this is it! Connect 4 is a perfect tool to interact with kids from other countries who don't understand English!I remember when I was in elementary school, my friend had this game, and we played together. It's such a classic game. But even today, it is still very exciting and fun for all ages and all nationalities!
title: Fun Classic Game for All Ages and All Nationalities!

author: Ted Gleason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2019
review_content: I always loved this game as a child when my sister and I would play for hours. Now that my daughter is old enough to play, it seemed like a no-brainer for her. The game is simple enough that she (2 1/2 years old) can play by the rules, but it's also versatile enough that we can just have fun filling up the slots with the checkers to make fun shapes and patterns. It's rare that a board game can be enjoyed in multiple ways for young children.The quality of the game is very good, and is easy to put together and take apart. The material feels strong, and I don't expect it to be a problem wearing out with repeated use. This has become a great addition to our board game collection. It's instantly fun, is easy and fast to put together, and can be enjoyed in many ways.
title: A great game for our young daughter.

author: Family_of_4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2016
review_content: WE love this game!! Our home includes 2 adults and 2 kids, ages 5 & 7. This is a family favorite....we usually have competitions until someone is the champion.We are very active in our church ministry, so we host A LOT, this is a great alternative to just having guests sit in front of the television. Usually when we pull this out, we have tournaments that include all the kids and adults alike, and everyone's competitive side comes out (all in good fun!) Its perfect, because each game is just a few minutes, and its something everyone can get involved in.This version is made of plastic, and although some have complained about that fact, its really no problem. The important thing is that it's a sturdy base and you can play without any problems!
title: A family favorite

author: Reid D Murray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
review_content: I can't believe all these positive reviews.  Their expectations must be frighteningly low.  I've played connect 4 all of my life.  Yes it's an awesome game.  But opening this box was a slap in the face.  Hasbro could not have made this thing any cheaper.  There can't be more than 15 cents worth of raw material in there.  I bet it costs Hasbro more to print the box than it does to produce the game.  I tossed out my last connect four game because my son was too young for it, and it seemed like the parts were always laying around the house.  Big mistake.  The old one was well made and would have been durable for a lifetime.  I didn't know they changed the construction.  The one I bought recently is so cheap;  I'm too embarrassed to have this thing out in front of adult company. The plastic has the strength, rigidity, thickness, and consistency you would expect to find in toys at the dollar store.  This reeks of a  CEO compromising a company's good reputation  for increased profits.  Hasbro revenues are  $4.6 billion.  They can afford to make this toy many times better, sell for the same price and still enjoy enormous profits. Hopefully Hasbro can make some corrections and go back to making a product that people will want to have in their homes.
title: Objectively; lesser quality than a happy meal toy.

author: Lee R. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2014
review_content: I am a 70 year old man, why would I order this. I was looking at games for my kindle. I did not want this. some how it was checked and I could not stop it.
title: I did not want this

author: Scari
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2015
review_content: The game is as fun as it was when I was a kid, but broke within a couple days. In order for it to fit in the box, you have to take it apart each time you use it, which is fine. The problem is that it isn't sturdy enough to withstand being taken apart and put back together repeatedly. One of the clips on the leg broke within a the first few uses. We glued it back together and it's been fine, but it really is cheaply made compared to how it was just a few years ago. Even the checkers are cheap now, not that it affects functionality or will break or anything, but it's definitely noticeable to anyone who remembers playing with the heavier red and black checkers they used years ago.
title: Still fun, but cheaply made.

author: mom_of_2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2015
review_content: Great classic game!  Decent quality.  One cant really go wrong with this game.  Bought it AGAIN for my 6y r old (I thought he was bored with it, so I gave it away the 1st one) who is into chess right now.  I thought it would be another great way for him to develop "strategy" and train his mind.  Boy, I am wrong!  He does not find it that interesting nor challenge.  He barely wants to play.  I guess it may because I also have "Tic Stac Toe" game at home which is very similar like Connect 4, but it is a 3D game.  Pls see my another review re "Tic Stac Toe".  Regardless, it is still another great buy and I hope my 3 yr old child will soon into it.
title: Great classic game!  But does not find it as challenging anymore for 6 yr old boy.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2018

author: history buff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2017
review_content: I use this game in psychotherapy with children, to gently facilitate relationship and communication. It's quite popular with some of my clients, especially like 8-12 year old's and more colorful/visual than checkers. It's a good two person game, doesn't drag, individual game time goes quickly, often with sudden unexpected wins but holds attention as it is mentally challenging school age to adult.It is inexpensive plastic, but has held up well to frequent assembly/disassembly.

The stand works great but, we only received 21 red pieces and 13 yellow pieces. My son was very disappointed when he couldn't beat me because he didn't have enough yellow pieces to finish his move and win. Missing 8 yellow pieces. I don't get it. : (

It is incinerated in my $50,000 campfire, beside my olympic pool(with diving board :D). author: bub
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2013
review_content: Frustrating for toddlers to put the pieces in. I play this with my preschooler but sometimes my toddler wants to join in. Not every single column has a separator on the top to keep the pieces from sliding straight down. So when she puts the pieces in and they are not perfectly aligned, they get stuck between two columns. If she pushes them down far enough, it is extremely difficult to get the pieces back out. Very cheaply made by Hasbro.
title: Cheaply made, frustrating when pieces get stuck

author: Christina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: Cheaper quality and you have to pop out the plastic pieces (legs and slider). On the positive side they popped out cleanly with no sharp marks. My kids are almost three and five so we use this with some supervision to mainly work on fine motor skills. My nonverbal three year old really enjoys seeing all of the pieces fall into place and has played with this non stop for three days now. We use it to count out loud our pieces dropped in, make color patterns and of course color recognition. It’s a little lighter and smaller than I remember and the kids knock it over sometimes but it’s sufficient and we got it for turkey day sales so it was worth the cost. Even though hasbro cheaper out it’s still a solid game and the kids really like it.
title: Wish I would have kept my childhood board games

author: TC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: For starters, I got this on sale for under 8 dollars, and I feel like that is all it is worth.  I was originally excited to get this and am now like: Meh we will see how long it lasts.  The plastic that the board is made of is thin and semi flexible in your hands - it is not sturdy.  The legs that attach and are removable for storage are made of the same thin plastic.  I do not feel like the board will last, especially if children play with it because of how thin it is and how they attach.  Something seems very likely to break.  Once it stands up it is not very stable either ans can wiggle when a child puts a piece in.  The slide on the bottom, while being made of thin cheap plastic seems to hold the pieces up well at least.  The pieces are not the standard checkers pieces that I was used to either.  The edges are crinkle cut, thin and cheap.  While I think it is functional, it is clearly cheaply made.  THIS IS NOT LIKE THE CONNECT 4 FROM YEARS AGO.
title: Cheaply made, but works

author: Selene Lariba
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
review_content: My son ordered this game to put in our travel trailer for when we go camping. It’s very easy to travel with, you just put all of the chips in a Ziploc bag. My boys are five and seven years old, and they basically set it up on their own. It’s very easy.  This game is great for anybody who is about a little mature three-year-old and over. It’s definitely a good game for adults to play with children or children to play with each other.
title: Purchase for Camper

author: Karen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
review_content: Not the sturdiest game set, certainly not like an original gameboard in a long-lasting box, but most kids will soon tear up even the nicest set, so maybe use this for a starter.  Then if everybody loves it, see if there's one available anywhere that's more like the "original" set.
title: Perfect for what I needed

author: Ilmanari
date_of_review: Reviewed in Mexico on March 6, 2019
review_content: Es un juego muy simple, sencillo y muy veloz. Estas características no son malas en absoluto, pues lo convierte en un juego que se puede jugar en cualquier lugar, y es apto incluso para niños chiquitos con supervisión. Ideal para esos ratos en los que tienes ánimo de jugar algo, pero no tienes el tiempo de una partida demasiado larga.

author: Keith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 28, 2016
review_content: Hasbro really should advertise that this version is different from the original. Using the term 'classic' in the name is entirely disingenuous. The mechanism to drop the discs is 100% different. The plastic is cheap and nasty. The stand attachments are different and feel less sturdy. The discs no longer stack securely (the old model had round bumps and dips around the edge that allowed you to stack them with ease, the new model doesn't). I bought this and Hungry Hippos in the same purchase. Hungry Hippos has been given the same treatment by Hasbro... it was unplayable so I returned it. Hasbro have altered a winning formula, for what reason I do not know, but these "new and improved" versions of their games are terrible. Avoid!
title: Avoid.

author: Catherine Emma Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 18, 2016
review_content: The way the counters are let out at the bottom is by sliding a piece of plastic back and forth. This was impractical and it kept falling off.Flimsy -  one of the legs broke off with in 2 weeks and game had to be thrown away.
title: The way the counters are let out at the bottom ...

review_content: Classico gioco da tavolo, un must che non deve mancare alla propria collezione di giochi per la famiglia. Facile da montare e da giocare! Preso in inglese x spendere meno, tanto le istruzioni non servono!
